titles: A worthy speech made in the House of Commons this present Parliament, 1641. 1 That Parliaments are the onely way for advancing the Kings affaires. 2 That the restoring of the property of goods and freedome of the subject is a chiefe meanes to maintaine religion and obedience to His Majestie. By Mr. Waller.
author: Waller, Edmund, 1606-1687.
notes: Annotation on Thomason copy: "1640" with the zero crossed out; and "1641".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: England and Wales. --  Parliament --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  Politics and government --  1625-1649 --  Early works to 1800.
